meanings.definition: A loose fold of skin hanging from the neck of cattle, dogs, or other animals.
meanings.sent1: The cow's dewlap swayed gently as it walked across the field.
meanings.sent2: The farmer noticed the dewlap of the dog wagging as it ran happily.
meanings.sent3: The dewlap of the pig flapped comically in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her dewlap was like a curtain, hiding her face when she looked down.
meanings.sent5: The dewlap of the bull was so large, it almost touched the ground.

meanings.definition: A similar fold of skin on a person's neck.
meanings.sent1: Grandma's dewlap wobbled slightly as she turned her head.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the patient's dewlap during the check-up.
meanings.sent3: His dewlap jiggled as he laughed heartily at the joke.
meanings.sent4: Her dewlap was a reminder of the passage of time, like a living hourglass.
meanings.sent5: The dewlap on his neck made him look distinguished and wise.
